gov.ca.dsm2.input.parser
Class Tables

java.lang.Object
  gov.ca.dsm2.input.parser.Tables

public class Tables
extends java.lang.Object

The in memory representation of all the tables. It is also converter from tables to the model toDSM2Model() and vice-versa fromDSM2Model(DSM2Model).

Each table InputTable in the input is represented here getTables() and can be retrieved using the name of the table getTableNamed(String).

Author:
nsandhu
See Also:
InputTable, DSM2Model

Constructor Detail

Tables

public Tables()
Creates an initial empty tables list

Method Detail

addTable

public void addTable(InputTable table)
adds a table to this list.

Note: Does not support adding the same name table twice to this list. If you need to do that use replaceTable(InputTable) instead

Parameters:
table -

replaceTable

public void replaceTable(InputTable table)
Replaces the similar named table. If it does not exist, it simply defaults to an add addTable(InputTable) operation

Parameters:
table -

getTables

public java.util.ArrayList<InputTable> getTables()
Retrieves the reference to the list of all tables.

Returns:

getTableNamed

public InputTable getTableNamed(java.lang.String name)
Retrieves the table named

Parameters:
name -
Returns:

toDSM2Model

public DSM2Model toDSM2Model()
The method to use if you want to convert from the raw table representation to a more object oriented structure. If you want to be more fine grained in controlling how to convert to the model other methods are available toChannels(), toNodes(),toReservoirs(), toGates(), toBoundaryInputs(), toOutputs()

Returns:
See Also:
DSM2Model

fromDSM2Model

public void fromDSM2Model(DSM2Model model)
The key method to use to convert from model back to table representation of the input. This method uses the replaceTable(InputTable) extensively to replace the appropriate named tables with information from the model. This means that tables that are not represented in the model are not affected

Note: currently even though inputs and outputs are parsed from these tables, they are not replaced from the model. This will be fixed soon

Parameters:
model -

fromChannels

public java.util.List<InputTable> fromChannels(Channels channels)
Finer grained conversion from model element. Use fromDSM2Model(DSM2Model) instead unless you really need this level of access

Parameters:
channels -
Returns:
